headline: Apollo Seeks to Reassure Clients About Rowan’s Epstein Ties
summary: In “select instances” Rowan and other Apollo employees provided information to Epstein in connection with his tax work for Apollo co-founder Leon Black, Apollo said in a letter to clients.  Epstein’s deep ties with Black have haunted the firm since 2019, when Epstein was arrested on federal charges that he molested and exploited teenage girls.

headline: Private equity stocks tumble as Blue Owl restricts fund redemptions
summary: Investing.com -- Shares of major private investment managers fell sharply on Thursday as Blue Owl Capital’s decision to permanently restrict investor withdrawals from a retail debt fund sent ripples through the private credit industry.

headline: Blue Owl Move to Curb Redemptions at Private Credit Fund Hits Alt Manager Stocks
summary: Blue Owl Capital’s  move to halt quarterly redemptions at one of its private-credit funds is hitting the asset manager’s shares and those of other alternative managers, including Blackstone,  Ares Management  and  Apollo  Global Management, that are active in private credit.  The action involving a relatively small fund targeted to retail investors run by Blue Owl is depressing the alt industry managers because of concern that redemptions could be curbed at other private-credit funds that are similar to the affected Blue Owl fund,  Blue Owl Capital  II, which isn’t publicly traded.  The largest nontraded private credit fund is Blackstone Private Credit, with about $47 billion in net assets, followed by Blue Owl Credit Income at $19 billion of net assets, and Apollo Debt Solutions at $14 billion, according to data from Raymond James analysts.
